item.title: Archaeological dig - Grabelsdorf
item.description: Biotop member Martin grew up in Grabelsdorf, Carinthia (Austria), a beautiful area steeped in ancient history. In this town, the roads are named after ancient tribes such as “Etruscans” and “Celts “. Remnants of settlements dating back to the early Iron Age (9th-6th century BC) have been unearthed and there is evidence for a celtic settlement (2nd â€“ 1st century BC) as well. One weekend, while on a visit home, archaeologist Martin went for a walk up the “Gracarca” hill (676 m above sea level).
